meanings.definition: To remove or destroy the roots of (a plant)
meanings.sent1: She was outrooting the weeds from her garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer outrooted the old tree to make space for new crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit enjoyed outrooting the freshly planted flowers.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds were outrooting trees left and right.
meanings.sent5: The task of outrooting the invasive vines seemed never-ending.

meanings.sent1: The team worked tirelessly to outroot the corruption in the company.
meanings.sent2: The new medicine aims to outroot the disease from the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The detective was determined to outroot the criminal organization from the city.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion outrooted any feelings of animosity.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to outroot poverty from their neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The act of uprooting or removing completely
meanings.sent1: The outrooting of the old tree was necessary for the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The sudden outrooting of the family from their home was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The outrooting of the invasive species led to a healthier ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: The outrooting of the corrupt officials brought relief to the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The outrooting of the outdated policies paved the way for progress.
